gui.nostalgic_tweaks.customize.reset.@To: This will delete all items within the list.

gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.speed.@Prefi:
The higher the swing number is the slower the swinging animation will be.

§aAlpha/Beta Minecraft§f: §b8
§6Modern Minecraft§f: §b6

§rIf you are§e photosensitive§r, it is recommended to set speeds to§e 0§r.
To set§d customized§r speeds for individual items, click the§d Custom Speed§r button at the mod's settings homepage.

gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.new.@Too: This is a§c new§r tweak in this update.

gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.general.over:
This section will make§e changes§r to§a all§r configuration values. Use the§3 Disable All§r button to turn§4 off§r all mod tweaks. Use the§3 Enable All§r button to turn§2 on§r all mod tweaks.

You can§c cancel§r to§a undo§r any accidental edits.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.general.conf: Pick a configuration menu that will appear when the open config§e hot key§r is pressed. Exiting a configuration menu will still take you the mod's home screen.

If you do not wish to see tags next to tweak titles then uncheck the options below. If you are familiar with what each tag means next to a tweak title, then you can also disable their tooltips from appearing. Turning§c off§r tooltip tags will§4 not§r turn off§b speech bubble§r tooltips.

It is§4 impossible§r for the mod to automatically detect mod conflicts. The§e tweak§r [ §c!§r ] status symbol appears next to config entries that have§c not§r executed expected code. Sometimes, this status symbol is§c not§r 100% accurate and may require that a tweak be§a loaded§r first. For example, the§e old 2D items§r tweak will§c not§a load§6 until§r an§e item entity§r enters the world.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.general.sear: This section describes§e search tags§r that you can use in the§e search box§r. Each tag and what they do is described below.
§4@new §r- Find tweaks that are new for the current mod update you are playing on.
§c@conflict §r- Find tweaks that are conflicting with another mod that you have installed.
§3@reset §r- Find tweaks that have been changed. Use the reset button to bring these tweaks back to their default state.
§b@client §r- Find tweaks that are controlled by the client.
§e@server §r- Find tweaks that are controlled by the server.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.general.shor: This section gives all keyboard shortcuts that can be used within this settings menu. Each shortcut and what they do is listed below.
§aSave§r:§2 §lCtrl + S §r- Saves and exits the config menu.

§bChange Group§r:§3 §lCtrl + Left or Right§r or§3 §lAlt + Left or Right §r
This will change which config group you are in.
text.autoconfig.nostalgic_tweaks.title: Settings
Disable all attack sounds like sweeping and critical hits.

Bring back the old 'oof' sounds when taking damage.

This only applies to player entities and will also disable custom player damage sounds such as drowning.
Disable the unique footstep sounds for mobs. Sounds will be replaced by the block the mob is walking on.
Bring back the old early 1.8 beta pickup sound for experience orbs.

Change the version text that appears in the top left of the title screen.

Use §b%v§r to insert the current game version. Use §b%§r followed by a Minecraft color code to get formatting. For example, §b%4§r will make §4red§r.
Remove any mod loader information from the title screen.
This option will apply the tweaks listed in this subcategory to the title screen.
Bring back the old dirt background for the title screen.
Bring back the old§a alpha§r animated Minecraft logo on the title screen. If§c disabled§r, the resource pack logo will be used.
Remove the black outline around the static Minecraft logo.
Bring back the old world loading screens.
Bring back the old lighting rendering from alpha/beta.
Bring back the old Nether lighting. This tweak changes the brightness and light shading directions in the Nether.

Bring back the old fog rendering from alpha/beta.

Here are the old render distance types and their values,§a far§r:§2 16§r,§e normal§r:§6 8§r,§3 short§r:§b 4§r, and §5tiny: §d2§r.
Bring back the old nether fog rendering from alpha/beta.
Change the sky color based on the selected version. This will also change the sky color in §4Nether§r biomes.
Change the fog color based on the selected version. This will also change the fog color in §4Nether§r biomes.
Bring back the old§1 blue§r void color in the far plane.
Overrides the dark void color when the player goes beneath the level's defined horizon height.
Bring back the old cloud level height at§e y = 108§r.
Bring back the old Minecraft version overlay on the HUD.

Customize the overlay text that appears on the HUD when the§e old version overlay§r is§a enabled§r. Use §b%v§r to insert the current game version. Use §b%§r followed by a Minecraft color code to get formatting. For example, §b%4§r will make §4red§r.

Bring back the old button look. Text on buttons will have a slight§7 gray§r color. When hovering, the text turns §e yellow§r.

§bTo get the old §9 blue§b button background and§c removal§b of the§r white§b border around buttons, use a resource pack.
Bring back the old durability bar colors.
Bring back the old item holding and swinging position.
Disable item entities from merging.§c This does not work in multiplayer yet.
Bring back the old 2D floating items.
Bring back the old 2D items in item frames.
Simulate 2D items when throwing item entities like snowballs.

Disable the enchantment glint on 2D floating items.

This will also disable the enchantment glint for throwing items and items that are in item frames.
Bring back the old tooltip boxes.
Disable the flickering of light from light emitting sources.
Bring back the classic explosion particles for all explosions.
Bring back the modern explosion particles mixed with the classic explosion particles for all explosions.
Bring back the old north/south sunrise/sunset. This also rotates the moon and sky fog.
Bring back the old non-transparent experience orbs.
Disable the item name that appears above the hotbar when selecting an item.
Remove all text formatting from the item name that appears above the hotbar when selecting an item.
Disable the particle animation that appears after attacking an entity with a sword.
Removes the damage indicator particles (the dark hearts) that appear when attacking entities.
Removes the critical hit particles that appear when attacking an entity.
Removes the enchantment hit particles that appear when attacking an entity.
Removes the custom fog color that is applied during a sunrise or sunset.
Replaces the disc chunk border with a square border.
Fixes the transparent gaps seen in held item models.
Bring back the old swing animations when breaking or placing.
Disable the animation modifier that changes how fast an item will appear after a swing or change in slot.
Bring back the old logic that controls the animation that plays when an item in the player's hand changes.
Disable the subtle animation that is applied to the arm when you look around.
Reverse the direction in which the arm sway animation moves.

Change the intensity of the arm sway animation with§a 100%§r being§a full sway§r,§e 50%§r being§e half sway§r, and§c 0%§r being§c no sway§r.

For a more intense sway, you can go up to§b 300%§r.
Remove the smooth animation that is applied when sneaking.
Remove the subtle animation that is applied to the arm and viewing distance when trying to move while colliding with a block.
A subtle animation that is applied to the arm and viewing distance when jumping or falling.
Disable the swinging animation that occurs when dropping an item on the ground.
Disable the disintegration animation and breaking sound that happens when a tool runs out of durability.
Disable the bobbing animation on a zombie's arm and the animation that occurs on a zombie's arms when the zombie becomes aggressive or attacks.
Disable the bobbing animation on a skeleton's arm and the animation that occurs on a skeleton when the skeleton becomes aggressive.
§aEnable§r this to§c ignore§r every speed in this list. The§6 modern§r speed will be used§e globally§r.
The swing speed for tools. Like shovels and pickaxes.
The swing speed when a block is in the player's hand.
The swing speed of items that are not blocks, swords, or tools.

This value will override all other swing speeds when haste is applied.

§eSet this to §c-1§e to§c disable§e.

This value will override all other swing speeds when mining fatigue is applied.

§eSet this to §c-1§e to§c disable§e.

This value will override§e any§r swing speed that does not match the given number.

§eSet this to §c-1§e to§c disable§e.
